item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Draft 309 Enhancement Grants Assessment & Strategy for 2021 – 2025
subitem_blurb: for Commission and public review and submittal to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Office for Coastal Management pursuant to §309 of Coastal Zone Management Act.  Discussion item only. (MJ-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0323 (Pigneri, Sunset Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Robert & Denise Pigneri to construct 2,419 sq.ft., three story, 34 ft. high, single family home with 464 sq.ft., attached two car garage, 242 sq.ft. deck at third story, and 990 sq.ft. roof deck, on vacant harbor-front lot; including proposed repairs to existing bulkhead with no bayward expansion, at 16750 Pacific Coast Highway, Sunset Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-19-1162 (Toor, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Billy Toor to demolish 806 sq.ft., 1-story single-family home and construct new 1,043 sq.ft., approx. 30-ft. tall, 3-story single-family home with attached garage and 306 sq.ft. junior ADU on 1,241 sq.ft. lot, at 722 San Jose Pl., Mission Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. (CB-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-20-0418 (Binns, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Ryan Binns to demolish 748 sq.ft., 1-story single-family home and construct new 1,338 sq.ft., approx. 30-ft. tall, 3-story single-family home with attached garage on 1,254 sq.ft. lot at 721 Portsmouth Ct., Mission Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. (CB-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-20-0435 (Santa Fe Christian Schools, Solana Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Santa Fe Christian Schools to demolish 9 existing 1-story classroom, support room, and restroom  buildings totaling approx. 11,000 sq.ft.; construct 1 new 3-story educational building totaling approx. 44,000 sq.ft., underground stormwater treatment facility, utilities, parking spaces, fire access lanes, landscaping and hardscape on 16.31 acre site at 838 Academy Dr., Solana Beach, San Diego County. (CB-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-20-0506 (Messenger, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Todd Messenger to demolish 1,020 sq. ft., 1-story single-family home and construct new 2,623 sq.ft., approx. 30-ft. tall, 3-story duplex with 2 attached tandem garages on 2,400 sq.ft. lot at 722 Island Ct., Mission Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. (CB-SD)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.
subitem_title: Progress Report on Caltrans Eureka-Arcata Hwy 101 Corridor Sea Level Rise (SLR) Adaptation Plan
subitem_blurb: Informational update on Caltrans District 1’s progress on preparation of comprehensive adaptation plan for protecting, relocating, or otherwise adapting the Eureka-Arcata Hwy 101 Corridor improvements authorized by CDP 1-18-1078 to address SLR flooding hazards. (RSM-A)

subitem_title: City of Point Arena LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-PTA-20-0040-1 (Farm Stays and Ag Exclusive Use Changes). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of Point Arena to amend its certified LCP to modify both Land Use Plan (LUP) and Implementation Program (IP) to add farm stays as conditional use in Agriculture Exclusive (AE) Land Use Designation and Zoning District, add regulations for farm stays to new section of IP, expand allowances for animal husbandry on AE lands, and address existing discrepancies between the LUP and IP regarding conditional uses allowed on AE lands.  (CK-A)

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-20-0009-1, Part C (Crowley Site Redesignation).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with Executive Director’s determination that action by the City of Eureka, accepting the Commission’s certification with suggested modifications, is legally adequate. (CK-A)

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-17-0049-2 (Emergency Shelters).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with Executive Director’s determination that action by the City of Eureka, accepting the Commission’s certification with suggested modifications, is legally adequate. (CK-A)

subitem_title: Application No. 1-20-0422 (Caltrans, Del Norte County)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Transportation to demolish and replace existing two-lane U.S. Highway 101 (Dr. Fine) bridge over Smith River with new two lane bridge with separated pedestrian walkway and construct temporary detour bridge, relocate utility lines, and replace culverts at Highway 101 crossing of Smith River, Del Norte County. (TG-A)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

subitem_title: San Mateo County LCP Amendment No.LCP-2-SMC-20-0056-3 (Agricultural Land Division Requirements)
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the County’s request to amend the LCP’s Implementation Plan (to modify approval requirements for public agency land divisions for public recreation purposes in the Planned Agricultural- and Resource Management-Coastal Zone Districts) is minor. (AB-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Chief of Enforcement on Statewide Enforcement Program. (LAH-SF)

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-20-0063-2 (Temporary Uses, et al)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by Santa Cruz County to amend Local Coastal Program (LCP) to establish and/or update regulations for accessory structures in residential zoning districts, home occupations, and temporary uses and structures, including temporary habitable accommodations for fire victims. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: Santa Cruz County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SCO-20-0064-2 (Vacation Rentals)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by Santa Cruz County to amend the Local Coastal Program (LCP) vacation rental regulations. (RG-SC)

subitem_title: San Luis Obispo County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SLO-20-0071-3 (Sign Ordinance)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by San Luis Obispo County to amend the Local Coastal Program (LCP) temporary and agricultural sign regulations. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: A-3-SLO-20-0072 (Central Coast Blue Test Wells, Oceano)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Jeff Edwards of San Luis Obispo County decision granting permit with conditions to City of Pismo Beach for construction, testing, and monitoring of two temporary groundwater wells and temporary pipeline to existing ocean outfall; and installation of temporary water tanks, sound wall, drilling rig, and above-ground pipeline at Coastal Dunes RV Park and Campground, at 1001 Pacific Boulevard, Oceano, San Luis Obispo County. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 3-20-0520 (Port San Luis Harbor District Paid Parking Program, Port San Luis)
subitem_blurb: Application of Port San Luis Harbor District to implement year-round parking fee of $3 per two hours of parking at 36 of 250 free parking spaces on surface lot at Harford Landing and at all 14 free spaces on Harford Pier; demarcation of paid parking spaces and to install two pay stations and signage, at 3950 Avila Beach Drive, Port San Luis, San Luis Obispo County. (BO-SC)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Carpinteria LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-CPN-20-0050-1 (Condominium/Cooperative Conversion Ordinance)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the City of Carpinteria’s request to amend the Implementation Plan portion of the certified LCP to replace the existing Condominium/Cooperative Conversion Ordinance. (JL-V)

subitem_title: Pepperdine University LRDP Amendment No. LRDP-4-PEP-20-0002-1 (Enhanced Parking and Storage Project). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for action for one year on Pepperdine University’s request to amend its certified Long Range Development Plan (LRDP) to allow for replacement of three existing surface parking lots with new parking lot in substantially same location adjacent to campus soccer field and baseball field, and install 23 underground storage vaults below new parking lot, at Pepperdine University, Malibu, Los Angeles County. (IQ-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 4-19-0339 (Carpinteria Sanitary District, City of Carpinteria)
subitem_blurb: Application of Carpinteria Sanitary District for floodwall repair project along existing concrete embankment within Carpinteria Creek consisting of 1,260 sq.ft. of un-grouted .5 ton gradation rip rap, 250’ of corrugated sheet pile, 1,110 sq. ft. of concrete fill, and 1,155 sq.ft. of grouted 1-ton gradation rip rap at, Carpinteria, Santa Barbara County. (WH-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Application 5-20-0017 (City of Long Beach Marketplace Marsh, Long Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Long Beach to remove approx. 60,000 sq.ft. of native and nonnative vegetation within Marketplace Marsh to increase water circulation and inhibit mosquito reproduction, maintenance plan of limited and periodic removal of native and non-native plant overgrowth utilizing hand tools and herbicide outside of avian breeding season for term of five years in City of Long Beach, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0437 (Simpson Holdings Garden Grove, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Simpsons Holdings Garden Grove, LLC to remove 140 sq.ft. floating dock and 72 sq.ft. gangway and construct 120 sq.ft. floating dock and 72 sq.ft. gangway including re-use of two 12” square guide piles, at 511 36th Street, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0543 (Del Villar, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Angel Del Villar to construct 68-ft. long, concrete deck cantilevered 5’ beyond bulkhead with 42” high glass railing along perimeter of deck, at 16842 Marina Bay Drive, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (CP-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-19-0074-1.
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the action by the City of Laguna Beach accepting certification of LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-19-0074-1 with suggested modifications to implement new regulations and standards for the operation of short-term lodgings (STL), or vacation rentals, and limit where new STLs would be allowed in the City, is legally adequate. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-NPB-20-0068 (Guidero, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Coastal Commissioners Hart and Wilson from decision of City of Newport Beach granting permit with conditions to Jim Collins for demolition of approx. 1,700 sq.ft. duplex and construction of 2,591 sq.ft. single family home, 475 sq.ft. two-car garage, hardscape, patios, site walls, drainage devices, and landscaping, at 413 and 413 1/2 Edgewater Place, Newport Beach, Orange County. (ZR-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: Application 6-20-0433 (Mission Bay Dr Channel maintenance, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Diego to clear accumulated sediment and vegetation from approx. 1,100 linear ft. of earthen storm water channel at Mission Bay Golf Course and construct approx. 1.65-acre wetland mitigation site and approx. 30-acre habitat enhancement site within Los Peñasquitos Canyon as mitigation bank for future projects, at 2702 N. Mission Bay Dr., Mission Bay Park, San Diego, San Diego County. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: CD-0007-20 (EPA, Statewide)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Determination by U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for National Performance Standards for Discharges Incidental to Normal Operation of Commercial Vessel. (AB-SF)

subitem_title: CD-0006-20 (National Park Service, Marin County)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Determination by National Park Service for 2020 General Management Plan Amendment for Point Reyes National Seashore and north district of Golden Gate National Recreation Area, including elk and ranch management actions, Marin County. (JW-SF)
